headline: USDT Supply on Tron Soars Past $80B Amid Growing Adoption
summary: The total circulating supply of USDT on the Tron blockchain (TRC-20) has surpassed $80 billion, according to the latest data from CryptoQuant. This figure marks a major milestone for the network as it reflects its growing dominance in the stablecoin market. Tron‚Äôs $80B USDT Milestone Since late 2020, Tron has experienced parabolic growth in USDT issuance, with notable spikes during bull markets. In 2021, supply jumped from $6.71 billion to $39.41 billion. This accounts for an increase of nearly 488%. The upward trend continued into 2025, as it rose from $59.76 billion at the start of the year to $80.76 billion as of mid-year. On November 13, 2024, Tron overtook Ethereum in total USDT circulation for the first time in three years, which highlighted user preference for its lower fees and faster transaction speeds. Importantly, Tron‚Äôs USDT growth has not been limited to bullish periods. During the relatively stagnant 2022-2023 cycle, the supply on the network still climbed steadily, amidst steady demand and adoption. Tron-Powered $2B Tether Mint The latest development comes just two days after the Tether Treasury minted $2 billion USDT on the Tron blockchain, in what appears to be the largest issuance in recent months. This was executed solely on Tron, which highlighted the blockchain‚Äôs role as Tether‚Äôs preferred network for large-scale liquidity operations due to its speed, scalability, and negligible transaction costs. The event was swiftly followed by a sharp uptick in stablecoin inflows to centralized exchanges. Interestingly, HTX Global received a net inflow of $1.24 billion in stablecoins within hours. CryptoQuant explained that such inflows often precede increased spot and derivatives activity, particularly in bullish market setups where traders seek to capitalize on short-term price movements or prepare for breakouts. Zooming out, the timing and scale of this mint suggest a strategic effort to prepare the market for upward price action. For Bitcoin, the influx of stablecoin liquidity translates into greater buying power. As traders respond to improved exchange liquidity, Bitcoin could see upward price pressure fueled by the fresh capital deployment. Cryptocurrencies, being inherently volatile and perceived as higher-risk assets, tend to benefit from this increased risk appetite. Large investment firms often allocate capital across various asset classes based on macro-economic outlooks and overall market sentiment. A positive stock market can free up capital or create a more favorable environment for allocating funds into digital assets. headline: US Federal Reserve‚Äôs Crucial Stance: Powell Reaffirms Dual Mandate Amidst Economic Shifts
summary: BitcoinWorld US Federal Reserve‚Äôs Crucial Stance: Powell Reaffirms Dual Mandate Amidst Economic Shifts In the dynamic world of finance, where every word from key economic figures can send ripples across markets, the recent statements from US Federal Reserve Chair Jerome Powell have once again captured global attention. For cryptocurrency enthusiasts and investors, understanding the Fed‚Äôs stance is paramount, as its decisions profoundly influence liquidity, risk appetite, and ultimately, digital asset valuations. Powell‚Äôs reaffirmation of the Fed‚Äôs unwavering commitment to its dual mandate‚Äîmaximum employment and stable prices‚Äîprovides a vital compass for navigating the current economic landscape. What does this mean for the economy, and more specifically, for your crypto portfolio? Understanding the US Federal Reserve ‚Äòs Core Mission At its heart, the US Federal Reserve operates with a clear, two-pronged mission: to foster conditions that achieve both maximum sustainable employment and price stability. This dual mandate is not merely a theoretical construct but a practical guide for monetary policy decisions that affect every household and business. When Chair Jerome Powell speaks, he is articulating the Fed‚Äôs strategy to balance these two critical objectives, often in a complex and uncertain global environment. Maximum Employment: This doesn‚Äôt mean zero unemployment, but rather the lowest level of unemployment that can be sustained without triggering inflationary pressures. It‚Äôs about ensuring a healthy labor market where people who want jobs can find them. Stable Prices: This refers to keeping inflation in check, typically targeting an annual rate of 2%. Persistent high inflation erodes purchasing power, while deflation can stifle economic activity. The goal is a predictable economic environment where consumers and businesses can plan with confidence. Powell‚Äôs recent testimony underscored that despite significant progress, the job isn‚Äôt entirely done. While the economy demonstrates remarkable stability, with low unemployment figures, the battle against inflation continues. Jerome Powell ‚Äòs Latest Insights: A Closer Look at Economic Stability According to reports, including those from Odaily, Jerome Powell informed Congress that the U.S. economy remains stable, a testament to the resilience shown in recent years. This stability is a foundational element for the Fed‚Äôs ongoing policy considerations. His remarks highlighted several key economic indicators: Key Economic Indicators: Indicator Current Status (as per Powell‚Äôs remarks) Implication for Policy Unemployment Rate Low Suggests a robust labor market, nearing maximum employment. Inflation Declined, but slightly above 2% target Requires continued vigilance; potential for further restrictive policy or cautious easing. Economic Stability Stable Provides flexibility for the Fed to act deliberately on inflation without risking a downturn. This assessment paints a picture of an economy that has weathered significant shocks, from a global pandemic to geopolitical tensions, and is now on a more even keel. However, the nuance lies in the ‚Äòslightly above 2% target‚Äô for inflation , which remains a central point of focus for the Fed‚Äôs next moves. Navigating Inflation : The Fed‚Äôs Persistent Battle The journey to bring inflation down from multi-decade highs has been challenging, and the US Federal Reserve has employed aggressive Monetary Policy tools, primarily interest rate hikes, to cool down the economy. While inflation has significantly declined from its peak, its persistence above the 2% target indicates that underlying price pressures still exist. Why is 2% the target? Economists generally agree that a low, stable rate of inflation (around 2%) is optimal for a healthy economy. It provides a buffer against deflation, encourages spending and investment, and allows businesses to plan effectively. When inflation deviates significantly from this target, the Fed steps in. Challenges in Taming Inflation: Supply Chain Disruptions: Ongoing global issues can still impact the availability and cost of goods. Geopolitical Events: Conflicts or trade disputes can lead to commodity price spikes (e.g., energy, food). Wage-Price Spiral Concerns: If wages rise too quickly to compensate for inflation, businesses might pass those costs onto consumers, creating a feedback loop. Consumer Spending Resilience: Strong consumer demand can keep prices elevated even as supply improves. Powell‚Äôs commitment means the Fed will continue to monitor data closely, ready to adjust its Monetary Policy as needed to achieve its price stability goal. This vigilance is crucial for all market participants, including those in the crypto space. The Impact of Monetary Policy on the Crypto Landscape The US Federal Reserve ‚Äòs Monetary Policy decisions, particularly interest rate adjustments, have a profound and often immediate impact on the cryptocurrency market. When interest rates rise, the cost of borrowing increases, making traditional investments like bonds more attractive and reducing the appeal of riskier assets, including cryptocurrencies. Conversely, a loosening of monetary policy, such as rate cuts, can inject liquidity into the system, potentially flowing into digital assets. How Fed Policy Affects Crypto: Risk Appetite: Higher rates tend to decrease investor appetite for risk, leading to outflows from volatile assets like crypto. Dollar Strength: Tighter monetary policy often strengthens the US Dollar, which can make dollar-denominated assets (like Bitcoin) less attractive for international investors. Liquidity: Quantitative tightening (reducing the money supply) can pull liquidity from the broader financial system, impacting crypto markets. Inflation Hedging Narrative: While some view Bitcoin as an inflation hedge, its performance has often been correlated with traditional risk assets, making Fed actions on inflation highly relevant. Understanding these dynamics allows crypto investors to better anticipate market movements and adjust their strategies. Powell‚Äôs cautious tone on inflation suggests that while rate cuts might be on the horizon, the Fed will not rush into them without clear evidence that inflation is sustainably moving towards the 2% target. Ensuring Maximum Employment : A Key Pillar of the Fed‚Äôs Strategy While much of the market‚Äôs focus is on inflation , the other side of the Fed‚Äôs dual mandate‚Äîmaximum employment ‚Äîis equally vital. A strong labor market is a sign of a healthy economy, contributing to consumer confidence and spending. Jerome Powell consistently emphasizes the importance of this aspect, noting the current low unemployment rate as a positive indicator. What does ‚Äòlow unemployment‚Äô signify? It means that the labor market is tight, with more job openings than available workers in many sectors. This can lead to wage growth, which is generally positive for workers but needs to be managed carefully to avoid fueling inflation. The Fed‚Äôs approach to employment is holistic. It looks beyond just the headline unemployment rate to factors like labor force participation, wage growth across different sectors, and the duration of unemployment. A balanced labor market, where both job seekers and employers benefit, is crucial for long-term economic stability. The current strong employment figures give the US Federal Reserve some breathing room to focus on the inflation challenge without immediately worrying about a significant downturn in the job market. What Lies Ahead? Future Outlook and Investor Implications The reaffirmation of the Fed‚Äôs dual mandate by Jerome Powell provides a clear framework for future Monetary Policy . The path forward will likely involve careful data dependency, with the Fed watching inflation figures, employment reports, and global economic developments closely. Potential Scenarios: Sustained Disinflation: If inflation continues its downward trend towards 2% without a significant rise in unemployment, the Fed may begin to cut interest rates, potentially boosting risk assets like cryptocurrencies. Sticky Inflation: If inflation proves more stubborn, the Fed might need to maintain higher rates for longer, which could continue to pressure crypto markets. Economic Slowdown: Should employment figures weaken significantly, the Fed might prioritize supporting the labor market, potentially leading to earlier rate cuts, even if inflation is still slightly elevated. For investors, particularly in the volatile crypto space, the key takeaway is to remain informed. The Fed‚Äôs commitment to its dual mandate means its decisions will always be guided by the twin goals of price stability and full employment. These are not just abstract economic concepts; they directly translate into the financial conditions that shape market performance. Conclusion: Navigating the Future with Fed Insights Jerome Powell ‚Äòs recent remarks serve as a powerful reminder of the US Federal Reserve ‚Äòs steadfast dedication to its dual mandate. The ongoing efforts to achieve stable prices while maintaining maximum employment are at the core of the nation‚Äôs economic health. While inflation remains a key concern, the progress made so far, coupled with a stable economy, suggests a cautious but deliberate path forward for Monetary Policy . For cryptocurrency investors, understanding these macroeconomic undercurrents is not just academic; it‚Äôs a strategic imperative. The Fed‚Äôs actions directly influence the liquidity and risk appetite that fuel digital asset markets. By staying attuned to the Fed‚Äôs communications and economic data, you can better position your portfolio to navigate the exciting, yet often unpredictable, landscape of cryptocurrencies. The journey to a truly stable economic environment continues, and the Fed‚Äôs leadership remains a pivotal factor in shaping its trajectory. Imagine making substantial gains only to see more than half of it vanish in taxes ‚Äì it‚Äôs a major deterrent for active trading and long-term holding. headline: Michael Saylor Proposes Strategy‚Äôs Credit Model for US Bitcoin-Backed Mortgage Plan
summary: Strategy Executive Chairman Michael Saylor has offered to share his Bitcoin (BTC) Credit Model with Trump‚Äôs Housing Director. headline: Cardano-linked Midnight Network set to airdrop 24 billion NIGHT tokens to BTC, SOL and BTC holders
summary: Midnight Network has announced that it will soon start airdropping its NIGHT token to XRP and Bitcoin holders. Apart from the two networks, Solana, Cardano, Basic Attention Token, Avalanche, BNB Chain, and Ethereum users will also get the token. The zero-knowledge proofs privacy blockchain with connections to Cardano disclosed this in a post , stating that the distribution process is designed to be fair and inclusive. Those who have held at least $100 worth of the native tokens across the listed blockchain network before Midnight‚Äôs snapshot can claim the tokens. Interestingly, Cardano has already taken some snapshots of random wallets across the eight different blockchain networks on the 11th of June, 2025, ensuring a wide distribution. This was confirmed in a short video on X by Cardano founder Charles Hoskinson, who said, ‚ÄúThe snapshot‚Äôs already been taken.‚Äù This marks the beginning of arguably one of the most significant multi-chain airdrops in crypto history, with over 37 million wallets expected to benefit from this largesse. The token prices will be based on the rates displayed on CoinMarketCap when the snapshots are taken. This is a security measure to prevent unwanted bot activities and Sybil attacks, ensuring a fair distribution and the safety of the process. According to the whitepaper, the NIGHT tokens will be shared gradually in 3 stages. The first stage, the Glacier drop, will see qualified users claim their full tokens within a 60-day window. Then, there will be a 30-day period when those people can claim the rest of the tokens by engaging in small computing tasks such as validating transactions or participating in the network‚Äôs consensus mechanism. Lastly, the Scavenger Mine is the final phase, where those who missed out on earlier claims but are eligible can get back a fraction of their original allocation. Participants can reclaim their tokens in this phase by performing specific tasks, similar to small computing tasks, within a given timeframe. Unclaimed tokens after this phase will go to the Midnight treasury. Cardano holders to get most of the airdrop supply According to information from the released whitepaper, there is a cumulative supply of 24 billion NIGHT tokens. Out of the 24 billion tokens, Cardano participants will receive 50% or 12 billion NIGHT. Bitcoin holders will also get 20% of the supply, totaling 4.8 billion tokens. Meanwhile, the rest of the supply will be distributed equally (according to CoinMarketCap Data) among holders of the remaining eligible assets, including XRP, ETH, BAT, BNB, SOL, and AVAX. This means XRP users will get 1.4 billion NIGHT tokens. What individuals will get will depend on their holdings during the snapshot. Thus, ADA and Bitcoin whales eligible for the airdrop will likely get the most NIGHT tokens. Unsurprisingly, ADA and other altcoins have seen a sizable jump in value over the last 24 hours. Eligible airdrop participants will start getting tokens in July Meanwhile, Midnight stated that participants can claim their NIGHT token allocation for the next two months, starting in July. Once this phase has ended, the second phase, Scavenger Mine, will start immediately and last for 30 days, while the Lost and Found phase is set to last for four years. However, all claimed tokens in the first two phases will be locked for a period, with vesting happening at 25% per unlock every 90 days for 360 days. This scheduled unlock has been classified as a Thawing and Redemption Period, and likely implemented to prevent immediate dumping on the part of the claimants. In the next four years, 25% of the claimed tokens will be released across four installments for claimants. Interestingly, claimants can either claim all their allotted tokens using the vesting schedule or wait till the end of the 360 days and claim at once.
